intro: Browallia exaltata, commonly known as the tall browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in shades of violet, blue, and white, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated as a garden ornamental due to its vibrant colors and relatively easy care requirements.
